name: precariousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the condition of being likely to fail or get worse: She was blissfully unaware of the precariousness of her situation. Some say investors exaggerate the industry's precariousness. Synonym
precarity
the dangerous state of not being in a safe position or not being held in place firmly: I was worried about the precariousness of the pile of plates the waiter was carrying. See
precarious
More examplesFewer examplesHe closes with a meditation on the precariousness of life. Statewide blackouts drove home the precariousness of California's energy situation.The precariousness of my posture on the ledge bothers them.
